text: Banff National Park () is the oldest national park in Canada. It was first started in 1885. It is in the Canadian Rockies, west of Calgary, Alberta. The park has an area of around . The park has mountains, glaciers, and ice fields. There is also a large coniferous forest. The main town near to the park is Banff. Banff is one of the seven parks in the Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks World Heritage Site. ==References== Category:1885 establishments in North America Category:1880s establishments in Canada Category:Canadian Rockies Category:Geography of Alberta Category:National parks in Canada Category:Parks in the Canadian Rockies
title: Banff National Park
